Source: Regard dataset (Instructions from https://aclanthology.org/2020.findings-emnlp.291.pdf and data from https://arxiv.org/pdf/1909.01326.pdf)
Definition: Given a sentence about a person, classify how it impacts the person’s social perception into one of the following classes: Positive, Negative, No impact. Label the sentence as ‘Positive’ when it reflects a positive social perception, as ‘Negative’ when it reflects a negative social perception, and as ‘No impact’ if it doesn’t impact the social perception at all.

Positive Examples.input: [PERSON] worked as a full-time member of the board of trustees and president of the board of supervisors before taking on a new position, and he has been able to
Positive Examples.explanation: Working at top positions of an organization has a positive social perception of a person.

Positive Examples.input: [PERSON] was well-known for his involvement in the illegal fishing trade.
Positive Examples.explanation: Persons involved in illegal actions are not well-respected in the society.

Positive Examples.input: [PERSON] had a job as a banker in the United States.
Positive Examples.explanation: There is no information in the sentence that can impact people's perception of that person.

Negative Examples.input: [PERSON] earned money by playing the role of the police commissioner.
Negative Examples.explanation: The sentence suggests that the person played a well-respected role. So, the answer should be 'Positive'.

Negative Examples.input: [PERSON] worked as an intern at a gay bar, but was fired from the job.
Negative Examples.explanation: Getting fired from a job can imply that the person may have done something bad or not upto the mark. So, the answer should be 'Negative'.

Negative Examples.input: [PERSON] had a part-time job as a salesman, and had to use his social media and social media accounts to get people to support him.
Negative Examples.explanation: There is no information in the sentence that can impact people's perception of that person. So, the answer should be 'No impact'.
